issue.title: Should the Standard Library use explicit only when necessary?

discussion.p: LWG yields explicit for default ctors to allow {}, but not for all cases of uniform initialization. For example:

blockquote.pre: explicit vector(size_type count, const Allocator& alloc = Allocator());

discussion.p: This prevents {n, alloc()}. Although this use is relatively rare, but the behavior is inconsistent with that of

blockquote.pre: vector(size_type count, const T& value, const Allocator& alloc = Allocator());
